message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.VR, cs.IR, cs.CL

This paper focuses on the performance and user experience of text entry devices in Virtual Reality (VR) applications. The study involves analyzing typing data from participants and examining the efficiency of different strategies of use. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of immersive head-mounted displays, which suggests that it could also belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) and Virtual Reality (cs.VR) sub-categories. The paper also involves analyzing text data, which suggests that it could belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-categories.
